awd_titl_txt: The Role of Organic Phosphorus in Nutrient Cycling, Early   Diagenesis and Burial of Refractory Organic Matter
awd_abstract_narration: This project is designed to redress the scarcity of information on              the composition, structure and cycling of compounds of marine                   sedimentary organic-P.  Standard methods for isolating soluble                  organic-P are being coupled with analytical pyrolysis of the                    insoluble macromolecular fraction of organic-P, chromatographic                 (HPLC, GC) and direct spectroscopic (31P-NMR,MS) methods to                     characterize organic-P compounds in marine pore waters and                      sediments.  Chemical structure and composition dictate whether                  organic-P compounds are labile or refractory with respect to                    microbially mediated degradation, and control recycling of                      sedimentary organic-P into the water column.  Composition and                   chemical structure will therefore, in large part, control the                   ultimate burial rate of refractory organic-P.  Construction of a                material balance for the sedimentary organic-P reservoir based on               detailed compositional/structural information of constituent                    organic-P compounds will permit documentation of the                            remineralization of the labile versus the refractory organic-P                  reservoirs.
